body.p:
Office Louisville Courier.
Feby 20th 1861.
Gov. Magoffin: --

A personal friend of mine, Dr Mandeville Thum of this city is ambitious of becoming an aid of the Governor. Knowing him to be a gentleman in the true sense of the word, and one who would do honor to the position, I dare solicit the appointment from you.
I am assured my dear Governor you will pardon the request, since it serves my friend and attaches him to you.
